meanings.definition: To fix or repair something again.
meanings.sent1: I had to refix the loose doorknob.
meanings.sent2: She decided to refix the broken chair leg.
meanings.sent3: After the cat knocked it over, I had to refix the vase.
meanings.sent4: Her smile refixed my broken heart.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to refix the engine to make it run smoothly.

meanings.definition: To attach or affix something again.
meanings.sent1: He had to refix the loose screw in the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The painter needed to refix the peeling wallpaper.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally refixed the stamp upside down on the envelope.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was refixed with a heartfelt apology.
meanings.sent5: She had to refix the fallen picture frame on the wall.

meanings.definition: To prepare or cook a meal again.
meanings.sent1: She had to refix the burnt toast for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: He decided to refix the overcooked pasta for dinner.
meanings.sent3: I had to refix the microwave meal after forgetting to add water.
meanings.sent4: The chef refixed the dish to perfection with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent5: They had to refix the dessert after it collapsed in the oven.
